info.name: strapi-plugin-migrations
info.description: This plugin allows you to migrate your content-types as well as their data between different strapi versions.

item.name: Basic interaction

header.description: Needed for javascript implementation because fetch will throw an error otherwise.

query.description: Allows a already existing migration folder to be overwritten.

request.description:
### Migrations.createMigration

Used to create the migration folder for the current version. Does not create any migration export data.

item.description: A set of basic requests to manipulate the underlying file structure.

item.name: Data interaction

variable.description: The version code of the migration that should be queried.

request.description:
### Migrations.generateLocalData

Creates the "${type}.data.json" for each content-type. The file is stored without any spacing to save some additional bytes.

The population of the file is paginated automatically in steps of 10 items per query.

response.name: Version not found

variable.description: The version code of the migration that should be queried.
The version code of the migration that should be queried.

query.description: If provided the entity will lose the reference to the old database.

variable.description: The version code of the migration that should be queried.

request.description:
### Migrations.readLocalData

Reads the created "${type}.data.json" and populates the created content-types from /migrations/:version/read with their old data.

The paramter "?removeReference=true" removes the created `id || _id` as well as the properies `created_at || createdAt`, `__v` and `updated_at || updatedAt`.

variable.description: The version code of the migration that should be queried.

response.name: Migration not found

variable.description: The version code of the migration that should be queried.

item.description: The first step to complete in the migration process.
